articles.headline: Selling Pieces of Law Firms to Investors
articles.snippet: Major retailers in England have begun offering legal services in their stores and online, a practice that may soon be permitted in the United States.
articles.abstract: Major retailers in England have begun offering legal services in their stores and online, a practice that may soon be permitted in the United States.
articles.lead_paragraph: Imagine an afternoon trip to a Wal-Mart: You pick up socks, a flat-screen television and a microwave meal. After checking out, you stop in the photo studio at the front of the store for a family portrait, and then shift one booth over to a lawyer, who drafts your will or real estate contract.

articles.headline: Europe Tries to Lure Chinese Cash to Back Rescue of Euro
articles.snippet: Beijing is expected to demand major concessions in any deal, which would be perhaps its biggest opportunity yet to exercise financial clout in the West.
articles.abstract: Beijing is expected to demand major concessions in any deal, which would be perhaps its biggest opportunity yet to exercise financial clout in the West.
articles.lead_paragraph: PARIS — A day after European leaders unveiled their latest plan to save the euro, top officials opened talks with China in an effort to lure tens of billions of dollars in additional cash, giving China perhaps its biggest opportunity yet to exercise financial clout in the Western world.
articles.byline: By Liz Alderman and David Barboza

articles.headline: Cigarettes Are Enlisted to Test Ways of Quitting
articles.snippet: Scientists have been studying the effects of lower-nicotine test cigarettes on smokers in an attempt to get them to quit.
articles.abstract: Scientists have been studying the effects of lower-nicotine test cigarettes on smokers in an attempt to get them to quit.
articles.lead_paragraph: When a truck recently delivered 45,000 cartons of cigarettes to a research company in North Carolina, it was a turning point in the government’s war on smoking.

articles.headline: Savings Rate Is Dropping, and Experts Are Puzzled
articles.snippet: With the latest decline in savings, some are asking whether consumers are returning to their old spending habits, while others wonder if the new data is even true.
articles.abstract: With the latest decline in savings, some are asking whether consumers are returning to their old spending habits, while others wonder if the new data is even true.
articles.lead_paragraph: When the recession began, Americans began to save more of their money, prompting predictions that their financial habits might be changing permanently.

articles.headline: In Florida Battle, Casino Cash vs. Disney Image
articles.snippet: The state’s need for increased revenues puts it at odds with its most powerful company, Disney, which opposes a multibillion-dollar plan for gambling resorts.
articles.abstract: The state’s need for increased revenues puts it at odds with its most powerful company, Disney, which opposes a multibillion-dollar plan for gambling resorts.
articles.lead_paragraph: MIAMI — The battle for Florida’s tourism soul has been joined.

articles.headline: Animation Gives an Edge to Streaming Services
articles.snippet: Hulu, the streaming Web site, has found cheaper shows and easy-to-get content in anime and other niche foreign programming.
articles.abstract: Hulu, the streaming Web site, has found cheaper shows and easy-to-get content in anime and other niche foreign programming.
articles.lead_paragraph: One of the most popular options on Hulu, ranking alongside mainstream TV hits like “Modern Family” and “Glee,” is an animated series about an adolescent ninja and his pink-haired love interest battling a mysterious organization.

articles.headline: Western Companies See Prospects for Business in Libya
articles.snippet: Security, construction and infrastructure companies that see profit-making opportunities receding in Iraq and Afghanistan have set their sights on Libya.
articles.abstract: Security, construction and infrastructure companies that see profit-making opportunities receding in Iraq and Afghanistan have set their sights on Libya.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The guns in Libya have barely quieted, and NATO’s military assistance to the rebellion that toppled Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi will not end officially until Monday. But a new invasion force is already plotting its own landing on the shores of Tripoli.

articles.headline: 12 Americans Die as Blast Hits Bus in Afghanistan
articles.snippet: A Taliban suicide car bomber attacked an armored shuttle bus in the single deadliest assault on Americans in Kabul since the war began.
articles.abstract: A Taliban suicide car bomber attacked an armored shuttle bus in the single deadliest assault on Americans in Kabul since the war began.
articles.lead_paragraph: KABUL, Afghanistan — At least 12 Americans were killed when a Taliban suicide car bomber attacked an armored shuttle bus in Kabul on Saturday, military officials said.

articles.headline: Heavy Autumn Snowstorm Barrels Across Northeast
articles.snippet: High winds from a menacing northeaster knocked out power for 2.3 million customers, and the storm threatened to topple October snowfall records.
articles.abstract: High winds from a menacing northeaster knocked out power for 2.3 million customers, and the storm threatened to topple October snowfall records.
articles.lead_paragraph: October, said the calendar. Before Halloween. And the 2.5 million trees occupying New York City’s open spaces confirmed it was fall — not winter — with glorious canopies of leaves stretching along their boughs.
articles.byline: By Al Baker, Elizabeth A. Harris and Sarah Maslin Nir

articles.headline: What’s Luck Got to Do With It?
articles.snippet: Bill Gates and other hugely successful entrepreneurs may have had good fortune in their lives, but they knew how to turn those lucky breaks into life-changing events.
articles.abstract: Bill Gates and other hugely successful entrepreneurs may have had good fortune in their lives, but they knew how to turn those lucky breaks into life-changing events.
articles.lead_paragraph: BETTER to be lucky than good, the adage goes.
articles.byline: By JIM COLLINS and MORTEN T. HANSEN

articles.headline: A Deal That Wouldn’t Sting
articles.snippet: In a foreclosure settlement with the federal government, banks would pay relatively little, proving again that accountability has been mostly A.W.O.L. in the aftermath of the 2008 crisis.
articles.abstract: In a foreclosure settlement with the federal government, banks would pay relatively little, proving again that accountability has been mostly A.W.O.L. in the aftermath of the 2008 crisis.
articles.lead_paragraph: AFTER months of back and forth, a deal that is supposed to punish large financial institutions for foreclosure misconduct may be nigh.

articles.headline: Outside Groups Eclipsing G.O.P. as Hub of Campaigns
articles.snippet: Able to operate free of many legal restrictions, independent groups have become a loosely organized political machine poised to rival, and largely supplant, the Republican Party.
articles.abstract: Able to operate free of many legal restrictions, independent groups have become a loosely organized political machine poised to rival, and largely supplant, the Republican Party.
articles.lead_paragraph: About once a month, a dozen or so of the country’s most influential Republicans meet in a bare-walled conference room in Washington to discuss how to make further gains in the Congressional elections next year and defeat President Obama.

articles.headline: U.S. Planning Troop Buildup in Gulf After Exit From Iraq
articles.snippet: The bolstering of American troops could include new combat forces in Kuwait able to respond to a collapse of security in Iraq or a confrontation with Iran.
articles.abstract: The bolstering of American troops could include new combat forces in Kuwait able to respond to a collapse of security in Iraq or a confrontation with Iran.
articles.lead_paragraph: MacDILL AIR FORCE BASE, Fla. — The Obama administration plans to bolster the American military presence in the Persian Gulf after it withdraws the remaining troops from Iraq this year, according to officials and diplomats. That repositioning could include new combat forces in Kuwait able to respond to a collapse of security in Iraq or a military confrontation with Iran.
articles.byline: By Thom Shanker and Steven Lee Myers

articles.headline: Protests Awaken a Goliath in India
articles.snippet: Anticorruption protests have stirred India’s middle class, which has benefited most from growth but had stayed away from politics.
articles.abstract: Anticorruption protests have stirred India’s middle class, which has benefited most from growth but had stayed away from politics.
articles.lead_paragraph: DWARKA, India — Shubhrangshu Barman Roy and his childhood friends are among the winners in India’s economic rise. They have earned graduate degrees, started small companies and settled into India’s expanding middle class. They sometimes take vacations together and meet for dinners or parties, maybe to celebrate a new baby or a new business deal.

articles.headline: For the Academy’s New Chief, a Balancing Act
articles.snippet: When Dawn Hudson was appointed in June to lead the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences, she brought a reputation for shaking things up.
articles.abstract: When Dawn Hudson was appointed in June to lead the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences, she brought a reputation for shaking things up.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — Bette Davis, the first female president of the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences, held the job for two months before quitting in frustration. That was in 1941.

articles.headline: Fighting Over Online Sex Ads
articles.snippet: In August, the country’s 51 attorneys general sent a letter demanding that Backpage.com close its sex-oriented section, and now a coalition of religious leaders has joined that effort.
articles.abstract: In August, the country’s 51 attorneys general sent a letter demanding that Backpage.com close its sex-oriented section, and now a coalition of religious leaders has joined that effort.
articles.lead_paragraph: What if the price of having a vital, well-financed string of newspapers included rare, but inevitable, sexual predation of minors?

articles.headline: Madoffs Aim to Write Their Own Future
articles.snippet: “Everything that I think about the victims — it’s hard to face, because there’s nothing I can do about any of it,” Ruth Madoff said in an interview.
articles.abstract: “Everything that I think about the victims — it’s hard to face, because there’s nothing I can do about any of it,” Ruth Madoff said in an interview.
articles.lead_paragraph: She stayed, and it cost her more than she ever imagined.

articles.headline: Concerns Are Raised About Genetically Engineered Mosquitoes
articles.snippet: Researchers have bred mosquitoes engineered to pass a lethal gene to their offspring, killing them before they reach adulthood.
articles.abstract: Researchers have bred mosquitoes engineered to pass a lethal gene to their offspring, killing them before they reach adulthood.
articles.lead_paragraph: These mosquitoes are genetically engineered to kill — their own children.

articles.headline: As Meeting Approaches, Fed Panel Is Divided on Direction
articles.snippet: Three conservative members say the Fed has already done too much; two liberals say the Fed needs to do much more.
articles.abstract: Three conservative members say the Fed has already done too much; two liberals say the Fed needs to do much more.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — When the Federal Reserve’s policy-making committee meets on Tuesday and Wednesday, 5 of the 10 voting members will arrive in open disagreement with the chairman, Ben S. Bernanke, about the direction of monetary policy. Three conservative members say the Fed has already done too much. Two liberals say the Fed needs to do much more.

articles.headline: U.S. Seeks Aid From Pakistan in Peace Effort
articles.snippet: The United States is relying on Pakistan’s Inter-Services Intelligence to help broker a peace deal in Afghanistan with the same militants that the agency has been accused of supporting.
articles.abstract: The United States is relying on Pakistan’s Inter-Services Intelligence to help broker a peace deal in Afghanistan with the same militants that the agency has been accused of supporting.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Just a month after accusing Pakistan’s spy agency of secretly supporting the Haqqani terrorist network, which has mounted attacks on Americans, the Obama administration is now relying on the same intelligence service to help organize and kick-start reconciliation talks aimed at ending the war in Afghanistan.
articles.byline: By Eric Schmitt and David E. Sanger

articles.headline: Perry Displays Varied Stance Toward Crime
articles.snippet: Gov. Rick Perry’s record on criminal justice is more mixed than his tough stance on the death penalty might suggest.
articles.abstract: Gov. Rick Perry’s record on criminal justice is more mixed than his tough stance on the death penalty might suggest.
articles.lead_paragraph: AUSTIN — By the spring of 2004, when Rick Perry had been governor for over three years, the Texas Board of Pardons and Parole had yet to recommend to him that a single death row inmate be spared.

articles.headline: Global Shares Fall as New Anxiety Arises Over Europe
articles.snippet: Markets fell in Europe and Asia as well amid renewed jitters over Europe’s debt crisis.
articles.abstract: Markets fell in Europe and Asia as well amid renewed jitters over Europe’s debt crisis.
articles.lead_paragraph: Stocks in the United States and in Europe were sharply lower on Monday as uncertainty emerged about the agreement reached in Europe last week to address the debt crisis there.
articles.byline: By Christine Hauser and Jack Ewing
